questions.question: 1. What does MIC stand for in microbiology?
2. Which of the following methods is commonly used to determine the minimal inhibitory concentration (MIC) of an antibiotic?
3. The minimal inhibitory concentration (MIC) is typically expressed in
4. Which of the following best describes the minimal inhibitory concentration (MIC) of an antibiotic?

answers.a: The highest concentration of an antibiotic that kills all bacteria in a sample.
answers.b: The lowest concentration of an antibiotic that inhibits visible bacterial growth.
answers.c: The concentration of an antibiotic required to prevent bacterial resistance.
answers.d: The concentration of an antibiotic that exhibits side effects in the host.

questions.question: 5. What is the purpose of determining the MIC of an antibiotic?

answers.a: To assess the cost-effectiveness of the antibiotic
answers.b: To evaluate the pharmacokinetics of the antibiotic
answers.c: To guide appropriate dosage and treatment duration
answers.d: To measure the toxicity of the antibiotic

questions.question: 6. Which method is NOT used to determine the MIC of an antibiotic?
7. In the disk diffusion test, what does a larger zone of inhibition around the disk indicate?

answers.b: Greater effectiveness of the antibiotic against the bacteria

questions.question: 8. Which of the following is a consequence of not using the correct antibiotic dose based on MIC?
9. Which test uses antibiotic-impregnated disks to determine the effectiveness of an antibiotic?
10. What is a potential consequence of using too low an antibiotic dose that is not based on MIC?

answers.a: Increased bacterial susceptibility to the antibiotic
